p: CSOs contaminate the receiving water with raw sewage and therefore with human pathogens. CSOs can lead to increased concentrations of pathogens in surface water [ 54â€“ 57]. Although treatment of the public water supply should remove these pathogens, a study in Massachusetts found associations between EP and GI illness in regions in which the public drinking water came from surface water and CSO discharges occurred [ 27]. We explore the implications of this finding on the present and future burden of EP-associated GI illness in our quantitative burden of disease estimate.
